bugs.description: Potential path traversal vulnerability due to unsanitized user input in DocumentProvider.resolvePath(). User-supplied documentId is used directly in path construction without validation, allowing malicious '../' sequences.
Unhandled Promise rejection in Model.save() - Asynchronous file write operation lacks proper error handling via catch() or try/catch block, allowing uncaught exceptions to crash the process

Potential path traversal vulnerability due to unsanitized user input in DocumentProvider.resolvePath(). User-supplied documentId is used directly in path construction without validation, allowing malicious '../' sequences.
Unhandled Promise rejection in Model.save() - Asynchronous file write operation lacks proper error handling via catch() or try/catch block, allowing uncaught exceptions to crash the process
Browser test file uses Node.js-specific 'child_process' module which is unavailable in browser environments
